description: All the valid configuration parameters for the Redis plugin for RoadRunner.

addrs.title: Redis Endpoint
addrs.description: The addresses or hostnames of the Redis server/cluster to connect to. If the number of addresses is 1 and master_name is empty, a single-node Redis Client will be returned, otherwise a ClusterClient or FailoverClient will be returned, depending on whether `master_name` is provided.

master_name.title: Redis Master Node Name
master_name.description: The name of the master Redis node. A Sentinel-backed FailoverClient will be returned if this value is provided.

username.title: Redis AUTH username.
username.description: The username to provide for Redis authentication.

password.title: Redis AUTH password.
password.description: The password to provide for Redis authentication.

db.title: Redis DB Index
db.description: The Redis DB index to select when connecting.

route_by_latency.title: Route by Latency
route_by_latency.description: Whether to route traffic to Redis nodes based on latency.

route_randomly.title: Route Randomly
route_randomly.description: Whether to randomly route traffic to Redis nodes.

dial_timeout.title: Dial Timeout
dial_timeout.description: The timeout when attempting to connect to Redis. Default or zero means 5s.

max_retries.title: Maximum Retries
max_retries.description: The maximum number of retry attempts when connecting to Redis. Default or zero means 3.

min_retry_backoff.title: Minimum Retry Backoff
min_retry_backoff.description: The minimum backoff duration when retrying connection attempts. Default or zero means 8s.

max_retry_backoff.title: Maximum Retry Backoff
max_retry_backoff.description: The maximum backoff duration when retrying connection attempts. Default or zero means 512s.

pool_size.title: Connection Pool Size
pool_size.description: The number of connections to keep in the Redis connection pool. Default or zero means 10 per logical CPU.

min_idle_conns.title: Minimum Idle Connections
min_idle_conns.description: The minimum number of connections to keep in the pool. Defaults to 0, which means no idle connection pool.

max_conn_age.title: Maximum Connection Age
max_conn_age.description: The maximum age of open Redis connections. Default or zero means no limit.

read_timeout.title: Read Timeout
read_timeout.description: The timeout when reading from a Redis node. Default or zero means 3s.

write_timeout.title: Write Timeout
write_timeout.description: The timeout when writing to a Redis node. Default or zero means equivalent to `read_timeout`.

idle_timeout.title: Idle Timeout
idle_timeout.description: The timeout of idle connections to Redis. Default or zero means 5m.

idle_check_freq.title: Idle Check Frequency
idle_check_freq.description: The time between checks for idle connections to Redis. Default or zero means 1m.

read_only.title: Read-only
read_only.description: Whether the Redis connection is in read-only mode. See https://redis.io/docs/latest/commands/readonly.
